newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Yeltsin heart operation begins - Tass.
newsitem.headline: Yeltsin heart operation begins - Tass.

text.p: President Boris Yeltsin's heart surgery began in Moscow early on Tuesday, Itar-Tass news agency said.
Before the operation, he signed a decree handing over his presidential powers, including control of Russia's nuclear arsenal, to Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin, Tass said.
If all goes according to plan, he will resume his authority once he emerges from the anaesthetic and is fit to govern.
Yeltsin, 65, was driven in a motorcade from the Barvikha sanatorium west of Russian capital to the Moscow Cardiology Centre where the triple or quadruple bypass was being carried out.
The operation was to be performed by a team headed by Russian surgeon Renat Akchurin, advised by U.S. heart surgery pioneer Michael DeBakey and others.
Kremlin spokesman Sergei Yastrzhembsky called a press briefing for 10 a.m. (0700 GMT)
